A Testing the time-homogeneity assumption Assumption 1 (time-homogeneity). ÃÅ½ÃÂµjt | CSj, ÃÅ½ÃÂ±j ÃÂ¢ÃËÃÂ¼ F(. | CSj,ÃÅ½ÃÂ±j).

For the implementation of the test, we set B = 500. We use the Kolmogorov-Smirnov and Cramer-von-Mises statistics (See (Ghanem, 2017) for details on the formulas). All p-values are higher than 10%, suggesting that the identifying Assumption 1 is not rejected at any 1%, 5% nor 10% signicance levels. The p-values for the standard parallel trend assumption are 0.99 and 0.90 for the Kolmogorov-Smirnov and Cramer-von-Mises statistics, respectively. B Nonparametric Estimates
